pageTitle: College of Arts and Sciences | Davenport University
textBeforeTable: Our faculty is pleased to support you in your quest for a strong education, rewarding career and fulfilling future. College of Arts and Sciences Leadership                      The College also sponsors two opportunities to earn honors designations. These are available to all students, regardless of their Department or major. Arts and Sciences Honors are conferred when approved projects are completed in five Foundation of Excellence courses, in addition to an Experiential Learning component. Davenport has the Phi Kappa Chapter of the Adult Learner national honor society Alpha Sigma Lambda. All students in the top 20% of the University, based on GPA, and who meet the adult student status as defined by the Society, are eligible to apply. For Students Seeking Recognition for Academic Excellence Math Bridge Program -  intensive, short-term study options offered outside the regular semester schedule.  Accelerated Learning Program (ALP) - enrollment options than can speed completion of Math and English course sequences. The Open Class Academy -  free, unlimited access, self-paced, preparation tools for the COMPASS Placement Exams in math and English. The College offers a series of English as a Second language courses and Developmental Studies courses in English and Math through the Foundations of Learning program. Students testing into the Foundations of Learning courses are also offered several programs to complete or place out of these courses: For StudentsSeeking Help Getting Started in English and Math
